intro: Fumaria densiflora var. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteateceland, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitats.
